questions.question: In parallel operation of generators Equalizer circuit operates by

options.a: Increasing the output of low generator and decreasing the output of high generator until they are equal
options.b: Decreasing the output of the high generator until it is equal to the low generator
options.c: Increasing the output of low generator until it is equal to the high generator

questions.explanation: In parallel operation of generators, the Equalizer circuit operates by increasing the output of the low generator and decreasing the output of the high generator until they are equal.

questions.question: Which of the following is false about three phase AC generation

options.b: Voltage measured between neutral and neutral

questions.explanation: An IDG (Integrated Drive Generator) is a modern electrical power generation type[cite: 1536, 1538].

questions.question: Decreasing the current in the field coil of a DC generator will
questions.explanation: The output voltage of a DC generator is directly proportional to the strength of the magnetic field, which is controlled by the field current. Decreasing the field current weakens the magnetic field and thus decreases the output voltage.

questions.question: What happens if a transformer is used at a frequency higher than that for which it was designed,

options.a: there is no hazard at all
options.b: the primary current will be reduced
options.c: There is a risk of excessive heat generation at the primary windings and subsequent burn out.

questions.explanation: A CSD (constant speed drive) is a type of modern electrical power generation unit[cite: 1537].

questions.question: What is the advantage of using AC power on aircraft?

options.a: Large power demand on aircraft is satisfied

questions.explanation: The advantages of using AC power on aircraft are that it can meet the large power demand of modern aircraft and allows for more efficient power transmission at higher voltages, reducing wire weight.

options.a: To convert mechanical energy into electrical energy

questions.question: What part of a DC generator is used to conduct the current from the armature winding to the external circuit?

questions.question: What type of voltage regulator employs contact points to rapidly switch a resistor in and out of the generator's field circuit?
questions.explanation: A vibrating-type voltage regulator uses a relay with contact points that open and close to control the resistance in the field circuit, thereby regulating voltage.

questions.question: Which parts of a DC generator are integrated and form a single rotating assembly?
questions.explanation: The armature assembly includes the armature coils and the commutator[cite: 1551].

questions.question: How can armature reaction in a DC generator be reduced?
questions.explanation: Both interpoles (or commutating poles) and compensating windings are used to counteract the effects of armature reaction, which is the distortion of the main magnetic field.

questions.question: Which generator control device maintains a constant terminal voltage?
questions.explanation: The Generator Control Unit (GCU) acts as a voltage regulator[cite: 728].

options.b: For low current and high voltage applications
options.c: It is suitable for both high and low voltage

questions.question: In a shunt-wound DC generator, how are the armature and field coils connected to the external circuit?
questions.explanation: In a shunt-wound generator, the field winding is connected in parallel (or shunt) with the armature winding.

questions.question: What is the combination of an alternator (AC generator) and a constant speed drive unit called?
questions.explanation: An Integrated Drive Generator (IDG) is a single unit that combines an AC generator with a Constant Speed Drive (CSD) to produce constant frequency AC power[cite: 1536, 1538].

questions.question: What electrical device on an aircraft converts alternating current to direct current?

questions.question: Which of the following is the rotating part of a DC generator?

questions.question: Which of the following is the rotating part of a large aircraft AC generator (alternator)?
questions.explanation: In a DC alternator, the field is rotated and the armature is stationary[cite: 1583].

questions.question: Which type of alternator rotor is used for low or medium speed applications?
questions.explanation: Salient pole rotors have protruding field poles and are used in low to medium-speed alternators, such as those driven by reciprocating engines.

questions.question: From where does a self-excited generator initially get its field power to start the generation process?
questions.explanation: A self-excited generator relies on the small amount of residual magnetism remaining in the field poles to produce an initial small voltage, which then builds up the field strength.

questions.question: For voltage regulation in a generator, which of the following is typically varied?
questions.explanation: Voltage regulators control the generator's output voltage by varying the current sent to the field winding, which in turn changes the strength of the magnetic field.

questions.question: Which device disconnects the generator from the battery when the generator's voltage is lower than the battery's voltage?
